title: Communication will not improve with voice chat.
body:
It's been stated 1000 times, and has been discussed.

The conclusion we all come to is that people will just be yelling in the chat when a team member fucks up calling them names and slurs and whatever flame you wanna call it.

No matter how hard you fix it, this game will make people toxic, its not a bad thing either since everyones a competitor but with voice chat this game will turn into a joke. 

As communication is, I'll admit its still shit. But what can we do about it, its pretty much apart of league. We gotta learn and continue to deal with it.

replies.body: the community is different from dota's community.

It's like people dont understand the option of muting lol.. You know, to ignore the person who decides to abuse voice chat, just like u can do vs people who abuse regular text chat?

Also, in my experience on Dota 2, i didn't have that many cases of flamers or dog barking or what ever.. and if i did you could easily just mute them problem solved..

If people focused more on communicating to win, maybe there would be less flaming in the chat. 'OH YOU DIDNT CALL MIA' -scrolls up- 'WELL YOU DIDNT PING IT ENOUGH'
If you look at CS:GO. People aren't as willing to talk shit because you're actually talking instead of hiding behind your keyboard.  So in a sense, it would lower toxicity due to that fact.
Voice chat would be the worst thing to happen to league since dynamic queue.
People don't pay attention to pings because they don't care. What makes you think hearing a cute 14yr old asian girl's voice telling them to not int will make a difference?
